title: Paramount in the 1970s
description: Museum of Modern Art (Midtown) presents a selection of 25 classic and lesser-known films that were produced or distributed by Paramount Pictures during the 1970s, including the first two Godfather films, Harold and Maude, Heaven Can Wait, Leadbelly, Nashville, Saturday Night Fever, The Secret Life of Plants, Three Days of the Condor, and more, with several films presented in new restorations.

title: 38th Chelsea International Fine Art Competition Exhibition
description: Agora Gallery’s annual juried exhibition features paintings and sculptures, handpicked among hundreds of international and local applicants, in a range of styles and media. Opening reception 8/22 6-8pm.

title: IndieSummer at the Rink
description: Rough Trade and Rockefeller Center team up for IndieSummer, a series of free concerts at Rock Center's rink. Tonight: Kassa Overall and DJ Miss Hap.

title: Ryze + Shyne
description: Brandon Follick, Edson Montenegro, and Papirossa host Ryze + Shyne, a morning show-style comedy/variety show, but at night. Featuring performances by Marcia Belsky (NPR), Sydney Duncan (Wild 'N Out), and Fareeha Khan (Comedy Central).

title: Written in Brooklyn: A Storytelling Series
description: Join host Carly Ann Filbin at the Wythe Hotel for an evening of stories told by colorful characters sharing their true tales with you. Tonight’s theme: ‘Simply the Best.’

title: Free Outdoor Movies: Little Women
description: Free outdoor movie screening of 'Little Women' at Pier I in Riverside Park South (The Hudson).

title: Free Outdoor Movies: Space Jam
description: Free outdoor movie screening of 'Space Jam' at Annunciation Playground (West Harlem).

title: U.S. Open Fan Week
description: Fall in love with tennis at the U.S. Open’s annual fan week, an annual week of events leading up to the main matches, including the qualifying tournament, the legends exhibition match, practice sessions, Arthur Ashe Kids’ Day, a block party, and more at the USTA Billie Jean King National Tennis Center (Flushing Meadows – Corona Park, Queens). Note: most events are free, with some requiring paid tickets.
address: USTA Billie Jean King National Tennis Center, Flushing Meadows – Corona Park, Queens
cost: Free, some events require paid tickets

title: SummerStage
description: NYC’s iconic summer performing arts festival returns with 85 free and benefit shows in Central Park and 12 neighborhood parks across the five boroughs. This week: The Gaslight Anthem and Joyce Manor at Rumsey Playfield in Central Park (Weds 6-10pm, ticketed benefit show); Inffinito Brazilian Film Festival presents a screening of 'Gerson King Combo' with live performances by Alcione, Larissa Luz, and DJ Nyack at Rumsey Playfield in Central Park (Thurs 6-10pm, free admission); and several Charlie Parker Jazz Festival concerts at various locations (thru Sun, free admission).
address: Central Park and various neighborhood parks

title: Brooklyn Books + Booze
description: Hear established and up-and-coming authors of different genres read from their current works every third Tuesday of the month at Barrow's Intense Tasting Room (Industry City). Tonight's edition features Meg Elison, Joshua Palmatier, Leslye Penelope, A.T. Sayre, and J.S. Breukelaar.
address: Barrow's Intense Tasting Room, Industry City

title: The Broad Squad
description: Kendra Cunningham curates this monthly throwback variety show filled with stand up, storytelling, and music. Tonight's performers: Kimberly Dinaro (Fallon), Cyndi Freeman (The Moth), Shelly Colman, Mel Ferraro, and Jenn Wehrung.

title: Marvel vs DC Drag Show
description: Capes and curves combine as your favorite comic book characters battle it out on stage at Ginger Von Snap's Marvel vs DC Drag Show. Costumes are encouraged, with a $100 prize going to the best.
